reviewText: This is one of the most unlikely Hugh Jackman movies ever. Jack Willis is a handsome roadtrain driver with a secret - he has just become a top-selling romance novelist. However, being a 'man's man' in the Australian outlook, to avoid embarrassment, he needs a name, a woman's name - and he chooses that of his best friend, Ruby Vale. He must do some fancy footwork to continue the charade when the glamorous city publisher, Ziggy, arrives in dusty outback Lucktown to sign 'Ruby Vale' to a major book deal. Ruby agrees to help Jack though it's for her own gain as well - the publisher will pay for her coming wedding (with Hamish, Jack's buddy). Accompanied by Jack, Ruby goes to Sydney to meet the media, appear on TV and cocktail parties, etc. Gradually, Jack realizes that he has fallen in love with Ruby, while Ruby is also touched by Jack's novel.I bought this on DVD from moviehunter dot tv.  Great service. Great movie!
summary: LOVE IT! LOVE IT! CAN'T GET ENOUGH OF IT!

reviewText: It took a while for me to get a copy of this DVD and a player that would work in the States, but it was well worth the effort.  It is a story about friendship, loving and being 'in love'.  There are many great scenes between Ruby and Jack, Ruby and Suze, Jack and Hammish, and Jack and Ziggy.  It's not a movie that you fast forward through the dull spots.One of my favorites along with "Kate and Leopold" and "Sleepless in Seattle".  I loved it!
Title: N/A

reviewerName: John Baranyai "Book Nerd And Ex High School G...
reviewText: In this movie we see Hugh Jackman who plays a "truckie" (long distance truck driver). He has a BIG secret, namely he has written a romance novel under the psuedonym of "Ruby Vale". Any Aussie Bloke (man) who could write a Romance Novel would soon come under the scrutiny of his "mates (drinking buddies) and no doubt his sexuality would be questioned by them and he would no longer be a part of their "shout "(his turn to buy drinks). So he enlists the help of his friend Ruby to pretend to be the REAL writer of his book. Hugh's character is "in love" (whatever that means) with Ruby but he has a sexual encounter with her publisher. I realize that millions of guys throughout the world cannot resist the temptation of  a sexual invitation of any woman but that don't make it right as the man once said. So after he gives her what Austalians  so charmingly refer to as "a good root" (sexual encounter)he professes undying love to Ruby at which point I nearly spewed in disgust(i.e. vomited) at the immense "Suspension Of Disbelief" required to watch this movie. I  give this movie 5 stars because I have always liked Claudia Karvan and thankfully she has appeared in much better movies than this which would not be a very hard thing to do!!!
summary: Yet Another AWFUL Australian Movie (They Do Make Lotsa These!!!)
Title: N/A

reviewText: This Australian film is pre-Hollywood Hugh playing an Outback Truck driver who writes a romance novel under his friend Ruby's name. When it becomes a bestseller Ruby has to keep up the facade so the macho cover doesn't get blown. Lots of funny moments and shots of Sydney. A good watch for Hugh fans.
summary: A pre-Hollywood Hugh Jackman Aussie Romantic Comedy

reviewText: I love this movie. Have watched it at least 15 times. Even bought a machine that will play PAL dvd's just so I could watch this and Erskineville Kings. He is so very cute in this dvd, young and you get to hear him sing just a little. A wonderful love story. Had a little trouble understanding some of the aussie lingo but gets a little easier each time I watch it.

reviewText: Yes, I bought it because of Hugh Jackman.  Then enjoyed the glimpse of the outback, and the sweet story of people growing in love because they like each other. Interesting that despite its being a "romance" the woman had a job, and a non-traditional one as well.  Nice supporting performances and gorgeous scenery added benefits.
